title: Projects
noProjectsHint: Create your first project to get started.

create.title: Create a New Project
create.projectNameHelp: The project name will be used as the folder name and container prefix. Only lowercase letters, numbers and hyphens are allowed.
create.projectNameHint: Only lowercase letters, numbers and hyphens are allowed
create.repoUrlHelp: The HTTPS URL of the Git repository. SSH URLs are not supported.
create.repoUrlHint: HTTPS URL from GitHub, GitLab or Bitbucket
create.accessTokenHelp: Personal Access Token for private repositories.
create.portHelp: The HTTP port on which the project will be reachable. Each project needs a unique port.
create.zipFileHelp: ZIP file containing the project files. Nested folders (e.g., project-main/) are automatically extracted.
create.templateHelp: Choose a template based on your project's technology stack. The type can be changed later.
create.autoDetectionInfo: The project type will be detected automatically:
create.zipStructureInfo: If the ZIP contains a single folder (e.g., project-main/), its contents are extracted correctly.

services.title: Services
services.rebuildHelp: Rebuilds all containers and starts them. Useful after changes to Dockerfile or docker-compose.yml.

customProject.info: This project uses a custom docker-compose.yml. The project type cannot be changed as this would overwrite your configuration. Edit your docker-compose.yml in the project instead.
customProject.integratedDbHint: This project includes an integrated {{type}} database. Connection details are managed internally via docker-compose and do not need to be configured manually in .env.
customProject.portRemapInfo: Ports are automatically remapped. Your services are accessible via the displayed external ports, not the ports defined in your docker-compose.yml.
customProject.infrastructureOnlyDesc: This project only contains infrastructure services (databases, caches, etc.) but no application services. The actual application is not containerized and will not start.
customProject.infrastructureOnlyHint: To run your application, you need to containerize it:
customProject.infrastructureOnlyStep1: Create a Dockerfile for each application service (e.g., API, frontend)
customProject.infrastructureOnlyStep2: Add the application services with a build: directive to your docker-compose.yml
customProject.infrastructureOnlyStep3: Push the changes and rebuild the project

info.name: Name
info.noContainersHint: Start the project to create containers

show.typeMismatchInfo: A different type was detected based on the project files.
show.projectTypeHelp: The project type determines the Docker configuration (web server, runtime, etc.). Changing it will recreate the container.
show.typeChangeInfo: Changing the type will regenerate docker-compose.yml and restart the container.
show.envHelp: Edit the project's .env file. Changes take effect after a container restart.
show.setupDbHelp: Uses {{filename}} as template and replaces DB variables
show.setupDbHelpNoExample: Inserts DB credentials and replaces known variables
show.envTipDb: Select a database above - the template will be used automatically and DB variables will be replaced.
show.envPlaceholder:
# Environment variables in KEY=value format
DB_HOST=localhost
API_KEY=secret
show.envRestartHint: After saving, the container must be restarted for changes to take effect.
show.sharedWithNone: This project is not shared with any other users yet.
show.noUsersToShare: No other users available to share with.
show.permissionLabels: View: See status and logs | Manage: + Start/Stop, Pull, .env | Full access: + Change type
show.deleteProjectDesc: The project and all files will be permanently deleted.
show.deleteConfirmText: Are you sure you want to delete the project "{{name}}"?
show.deleteConfirmList1: All containers will be stopped and removed
show.deleteConfirmList2: All project files will be deleted
show.deleteConfirmList3: The database will not be automatically deleted
show.deleteConfirmList4: An existing workspace will be stopped and deleted
show.gitDisconnectConfirm: Do you really want to disconnect the Git connection?
show.gitDisconnectNote: Project files will remain, but Git information and stored credentials will be deleted.
show.autoDeployHelp: Enable Auto-Deploy to automatically deploy when new commits are pushed to the repository. The server checks regularly for changes.
show.intervalTooltip: How often the server checks the repository for new commits
show.autoDeployInfo: Enable Auto-Deploy to automatically deploy on new commits.

git.title: Git
git.disconnectConfirm: Really disconnect Git connection? Project files will remain.

webhook.help: Webhooks enable instant deployment on push events. Faster than polling since the Git provider notifies your system directly.
webhook.secretWarning: This secret is only displayed once! Copy it now and store it safely.
webhook.regenerateConfirm: The old secret will become invalid. You'll need to update the webhook at your Git provider. Continue?
webhook.branchInfo: Only pushes to the "{{branch}}" branch will trigger a deployment.
webhook.info: Enable webhooks for instant deployments on push events. Faster than the polling interval.

github.step1: Go to Repository → Settings → Webhooks → Add webhook
github.step4: Paste the secret and select "Just the push event"

gitlab.step2: Enter the webhook URL and the secret as "Secret token"

bitbucket.step1: Go to Repository → Settings → Webhooks → Add webhook

sharing.title: Share project
sharing.noShares: This project is not shared with anyone.
sharing.permissionHelp: View: Only status/logs. Manage: + Start/Stop, Pull, .env. Full access: + Change type.

clone.modalDescription: A complete copy of the project will be created. The copy is independent from the original.
clone.info2: A new port is automatically assigned
clone.info3: Git connection is not transferred (independent copy)

delete.title: Delete project
